concept.title: Attributes: Directory Entry Details and Listings
concept.shortdesc: Describes an example that creates files and directories and retrieves information about them.

section.title: Download
section.p: Click on the following link to download the example: Attributes.zip
Click on the following link to download additional files: CommonFramework.zip
Browse Attributes to view the example code.
Browse CommonFramework to view additional files.

section.title: Description
section.p: Attributes is an example of how to create a file, and retrieve its entry details and attributes. This demonstrates the use of the TEntry class. A CDir object contains an array of TEntrys which may be retrieved by a call to RFs::GetDir().

section.title: Running the example
section.p: The code creates several files and directories inside a top level directory called \f32examp\ on the default drive. Before the program terminates, all files and directories created by the program are deleted.
